did.abstract: Founder and first secretary of the Michigan State Board of Health; papers of Baker and his son Howard B. Baker.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Dr. Burton Baker (Donor no. 6965) and came to the library in 1983.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Henry B. Baker papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Henry B. Baker was a founder and first secretary of the Michigan State Board of Health

scopecontent.p: The Baker collection includes correspondence, reports, and other manuscripts relating to professional activities and his interest in public health matters. There are also some papers of his son Howard B. Baker, notably notebooks and papers while he was a student at Michigan Agricultural College.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Dept. of Medicine and Surgery.
controlaccess.subject: Public health--Michigan.

did.unittitle: Resolutions, reports and related re State Board of Health activities, 1878-1900
Articles and clippings about Henry B. Baker
Student notebooks, 1891-1892 of Howard B. Baker
Student addresses and papers of Howard B. Baker
Portraits of Baker and others; also collected commercial photographs of Mexico, old people, and a steam disinfecting plant
